* The etymology of "pure" is uncertain, but it is thought to be derived from the Latin word "purus", meaning "clean" or "pure". * "Agnus Dei" is a Latin phrase meaning "Lamb of God". * The etymology of "esordio" is uncertain, but it is thought to be derived from the Greek words "ex" (meaning "out of") and "hordion" (meaning "beginning"). * The etymology of "parola" is uncertain, but it is thought to be derived from the Latin word "parabola", meaning "a comparison" or "a story". * The etymology of "concordia" is uncertain, but it is thought to be derived from the Latin words "con" (meaning "with") and "cordia" (meaning "heart").
